DataElement.preferredName: Cytogenetic Analysis BCR-ABL Oncoprotein Cell Assessment Ratio Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the ratio of a measured value related to techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities by an onco-protein generated from the fusion of Bcr and Abl genes by translocation process between chromosome 9 and 22 (Philadelphia chromosome), in CML (P210) and some ALL (P190).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cytogenetic Analysis BCR-ABL Oncoprotein Cell Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities by an onco-protein generated from the fusion of Bcr and Abl genes by translocation process between chromosome 9 and 22 (Philadelphia chromosome), in CML (P210) and some ALL (P190).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.

Concepts.definition: Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.

Property.preferredDefinition: An onco-protein generated from the fusion of Bcr and Abl genes by translocation process between chromosome 9 and 22 (Philadelphia chromosome), in CML (P210) and some ALL (P190).:The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.:Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: A fusion protein encoded by the BCR/ABL1 fusion gene. This protein is comprised of the N-terminus of the breakpoint cluster region protein fused to almost the entire tyrosine-protein kinase ABL1 protein.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the ratio of a measured value to the upper limit of normal.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The ratio of two or more signals, typically between two channels.  Of type float. (caMAGE):A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
